Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2007 12:54AM kiwi1024 wrote: Barbara, I found what you said to be so humorous!! I can say that because i felt the same way as far as not being upset!  I also have felt alittle guilty about how others seem more concerned about all this than me.  I was on a losing diet with WW when all this came about.  My thought was Chemo will make me lose weight so I'm having Krispy Kremes today! ha ha I have 2 sons who are preachers and my faith is strong so I seem to be taking this all in stride.  I keep telling people I turn 50 Oct 24th and I'm going to get a boob job, a breast lift and a tummy tuck! What's there to cry about?! My problem is I have unrealistic images. I am a 186 pound 5 foot women with saggy breast and a big pot belly.    I think in my mind i'm picturing what I will look like after the surgery. A 30 year old Again!! The reality is I am aware of the seriousness of all of this but the truth for me seems to be that its totally out of my hands, I have no control over this but I know the one who does so its hard to be afraid when He is in control.  Now that doesn't mean I enjoy pain and I do hate the thought of suffering any pain.  But for me I feel totally confident in the removal of the cancer and the benifit will be the tummy tuck. You will be fine. Oh and by the way I am now allowing people to pamper me!  I'M SOOOOO AWFUL!!! ha ha ha
